image.altText: A man and woman stand in a doorway holding their six month old daughter.

props.synopsis: Australia has a growing cohort of forever renters and experts say the government should be looking to examples in other countries where more social and affordable housing options are being developed.

title.children: Forever renters want solutions. Experts say look at Vienna

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Andrew Wilkie has asked the PM to allow a free vote on banning gambling advertising and it appears many Labor MPs would support it.

title.children: 'Broad, unspoken consensus': silent Labor MPs want action on gambling

image.altText: Graffiti on a bus stop in the Melbourne suburb of Melton.

props.synopsis: Five young people have died due to knife violence in two and a half years in the Melbourne suburb of Melton. Residents fear the situation is "out of hand".

title.children: In the world of Melbourne's youth gangs, tit-for-tat 'beefs' are turning deadly

image.altText: Dental treatment

props.synopsis: Do I walk away from private insurance and trust that health challenges will have me seen promptly enough in the public system?

title.children: A trip to the dentist made me question my private health insurance

image.altText: An old man

props.synopsis: James Watson, the controversial American biologist whose 1953 discovery of the structure of DNA ushered in the age of genetics, has died.

title.children: James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: European leaders now feel a very existential threat from Russia but it seems their own problems at home are constraining them from doing anything about it.

title.children: Ukraine needs Europe more than ever as Trump loses interest

image.altText: Image of blue and white NSW Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A one-year-old girl has died after being clipped by a freight train in the New South Wales north-western slopes.

title.children: Toddler dies after being struck by freight train

image.altText: Smiling Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves, wears black jacket, white shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: The world's richest man's believers have once again agreed to enrich the Tesla boss to levels far beyond the realm of ordinary billionaires. But how much is enough?

title.children: Elon Musk's potential trillion-dollar payday not just about money

image.altText: A board flashes red to show which flights have been cancelled.

props.synopsis: With politicians in a bitter stand-off over spending priorities, Congress has ground to a standstill.

title.children: Hundreds of US flights cancelled as government shutdown drags on

image.altText: A bearded man wearing a suit with a red tie looks on with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The United States and Britain remove sanctions on Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa, a day after the United Nations Security Council did the same.

title.children: US, UK lift sanctions on Syrian president Ahmed al-Sharaa

image.altText: Storm clouds gather over Mornington in Victoria

props.synopsis: Australia's weather has been highly volatile during the past fortnight, and this weekend will serve up another smorgasbord of atmospheric variability.

title.children: Spring see-saw brings weekend heat, storms and snow

image.altText: Damien Richardson speaking

props.synopsis: Former Neighbours star Damien Richardson performed an illegal Nazi salute in public but was not intending to display loyalty to Adolf Hitler, a magistrate says.

title.children: Magistrate rules Neighbours star's public Nazi salute was not theatrical

image.altText: An older woman in an elaborate hat smiles as she stands in a garden.

props.synopsis: The Princess Royal will make a quick trip to Australia to mark an important military anniversary.

title.children: Princess Anne is coming to Australia. Here's what we know of her plans

image.altText: Aine McDonagh kneels on the ground as she receives treatment during AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Injury-ravaged Hawthorn is counting the cost of its heavy loss to North Melbourne in the opening AFLW qualifying final.

title.children: Hawks faced with fresh injury concerns ahead of sudden-death AFLW semi

image.altText: Oscar Piastri looks on during practice at the São Paulo Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Lando Norris strikes the first significant blow of the São Paulo Grand Prix weekend by outpacing Oscar Piastri to take pole for the sprint race.

title.children: Piastri trails Norris in sprint qualifying at São Paulo Grand Prix

image.altText: Man inspecting tree branch

props.synopsis: Across the Blue Mountains, apple farmers are noticing less fruit this season. Some are wondering if it's linked to varroa mite.

title.children: These trees are usually laden with apples. This year they're strangely bare

image.altText: A young protester in Madagascar wearing a flag with a skull and crossbones.

props.synopsis: Youth demonstrations in Madagascar are the latest in a number of gen Z protests across parts of Asia, Africa and South America, and young people are galvanised to join some of the largest protests of their generation.

title.children: One Piece defines gen Z protests from Madagascar to Indonesia

image.altText: A artists drawing of a buse driving on a raod with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The same Chinese company that makes electric buses now under review in Denmark and Norway also has electric buses on Australian roads.

title.children: Chinese buses on Australian roads spark cybersecurity concerns

image.altText: An empty aircraft carrier travelling in the ocean.

props.synopsis: China commissions its first home-built aircraft carrier, which experts say will help what is already the world's largest navy expand power beyond its own waters.

title.children: China's new aircraft carrier shows it is seeking power far from its coast

image.altText: An airplane dropping a sheet of water, darkening the ground, in a eucalypt forest

props.synopsis: Ahead of bushfire season, the SA Country Fire Service's air operations teams clear out the cobwebs and take to the skies to simulate bushfires in the Flinders Ranges.

title.children: Country Fire Service prepares for summer by taking to the air

image.altText: A crowd of people standing outside next to a bus

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old student from an adjacent school is being investigated by Indonesian police after explosions injured 55 people on Friday.

title.children: Explosions at a mosque in an Indonesian high school injure 54

image.altText: A woman with a large headdress made of plants and flowers alone in a room backstage.

props.synopsis: Beauty pageants remain serious business in the Pacific, but contestants are thinking twice before entering due to online bullying and discrimination.

title.children: Colourism and bullying: The controversial world of island beauty pageants

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a pink blouse sitting on a couch in a TV studio

props.synopsis: Prosecutors said there was "unequivocal scientific evidence" Julia Wandelt had no familial link to the McCanns.

title.children: Woman convicted in UK of harassing Maddie McCann's parents

image.altText: A poster of a young girl holding a teddy bear

props.synopsis: Temu and Shein are under increasing pressure to explain how child sex abuse dolls were sold worldwide on their multi-billion-dollar platforms following international outrage.

title.children: Shein, Temu face more pressure after claims pleas on sex dolls were 'ignored'

image.altText: Jamie Melham rides Half Yours at Flemington

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: A Melbourne Cup winner, a media storm and a toilet culprit

image.altText: A Graphic showing a person's hand holding a phone displaying the "BOM" website while a bolt of lightning flashes behind it.

props.synopsis: As bushfire season approaches, firefighters say the BOM's redesigned website is missing crucial safety data — a gap some fire chiefs fear could put lives at risk.

title.children: Firefighters sound alarm over missing data on new BOM site

image.altText: Milutin Osmajic playing in English Championship competition.

props.synopsis: Montenegro striker Milutin Osmajić is suspended for nine matches for racially abusing an opponent during a match in England's second-tier Championship last season.

title.children: England's FA bans player for nine matches over racial abuse

image.altText: A group of AFLW players wearing blue and white stripes celebrate a goal

props.synopsis: North Melbourne registers its 25th consecutive win with a 39-point drubbing of Hawthorn in the first AFLW qualifying final.

title.children: Kangaroos dominate goalless Hawks in first AFLW qualifying final

image.altText: A sleeping bag lies in dirt in an outback area. Police vehicles are parked a short distance away.

props.synopsis: Police charge a man after an investigation into an incident at a WA rodeo that left an 18-year-old with a collapsed lung and broken ribs.

title.children: Police charge 19-year-old after young man run over while sleeping in swag

image.altText: Sam Konstas plays a ramp shot against India

props.synopsis: The former Australian captain believes it is time for the talented opener to go back to basics as he finds himself on the outer as the Ashes begin.

title.children: Mark Taylor says Sam Konstas must ditch ramp shots to revive his Test career

image.altText: An architectural render featuring modern buildings and an abundance of pedestrians.

props.synopsis: The WA premier insists a cancelled upgrade of the Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre would not have been value for money, despite the deputy premier previously describing the building as a "cockroach".

title.children: Why plans for 'cockroach' building upgrade were scrapped

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a dark suit as he sits and holds his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: Shareholders at Tesla's Texas factory chanted "Elon, Elon" as they overwhelmingly approved the largest-ever CEO compensation package for the company's controversial boss.

title.children: 'I super appreciate it': How Elon Musk lined up a trillion-dollar payday

image.altText: Road signs at a dusty outback intersection.

props.synopsis: A former police officer who travelled more than 700 kilometres to steal $100,000 from a convicted sex offender has been jailed for 10 years.

title.children: Ex-NSW cop jailed for stealing $100K from sex offender in home invasion

image.altText: Meta logo in background in focus with blurry silhouette heads in foreground.

props.synopsis: Users of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp are exposed to fraudulent e-commerce and investment schemes, illegal online casinos, and the sale of banned medical products.

title.children: Meta forecast $24b revenue from scam ads, internal documents show

image.altText: A man wearing a red leather jacket, with curly locks across his forehead, smiles

props.synopsis: Antoine Fuqua's movie was meant to be released months ago, but was delayed twice because of reshoots and eventually pushed back to April 2026 — a whole year behind schedule.

title.children: Trailer for Michael Jackson biopic released a year behind schedule — with a glaring gap
